intro: Polyosma havilandii, commonly known as the Haviland's polyosma, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
